definition: to examine/to probe/to scout out/to nose around
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward
see 山查[shan1 zha1]
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: Conclusion The above procedure is necessary for the ankle sprains with the injury of the common peroneal nerve.

sentences.english: She want to prob my hurt, want to know I think.

sentences.english: Conclusion Operations research should be done immediately for the cases with early diagnosis or high …

sentences.english: After the teaching intervention, ascertains the situation of student's conceptual understanding.

sentences.english: The fist part is about the research on probability of Zhao's misreading.

sentences.english: Today the principal tools for prospecting the brain are electrical.

sentences.english: The second case, a 94-year-old male with senile dementia was arranged for exploratory laparotomy.
